name: American Indian Center of Indiana, Inc.
description: Offers health education, screenings, and referral services through its Circle of Wellness Program. They also provide health-related cultural competency workshops
services: American-Indian-owned Disease management in Indiana consultation

name: Thundermaker Wellness Center
description: An Indigenous-owned and operated behavioral health wellness center providing evidence-based treatment interwoven with cultural and traditional practices. They focus on treating the whole person for long-term recovery from addiction and behavioral health issues
services: American-Indian-owned Disease management in Indiana consultation

name: Mshkiki Community Clinic
description: Owned and operated by the Pokagon Band of Potawatomi, this clinic serves indigenous peoples in Southwest Michigan and Northern Indiana, offering medical, dental, pharmacy, and behavioral health services with an integrative care approach
services: American-Indian-owned Disease management in Indiana consultation

name: Indiana Health Centers, Inc.
description: A Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC) providing medical, dental, and behavioral health care to underserved and uninsured populations in Indiana. They offer primary care on a sliding fee scale
services: American-Indian-owned Disease management in Indiana consultation

name: Indian Health Service (IHS)
description: An agency within the Department of Health and Human Services responsible for providing federal health services to American Indians and Alaska Natives. They offer a comprehensive health service delivery system
services: American-Indian-owned Disease management in Indiana consultation
